question_text: Which of the following best describes the underlying structure of a cellular network?
answer_options: All users connect to a single central antenna
Each user is assigned a dedicated frequency channel for the entire session
The service area is divided into cells, each with its own antenna
Internet is broadcast omnidirectionally across an entire country
correct_answer: The service area is divided into cells, each with its own antenna
explanation: Cellular networks divide the coverage area into cells. Each cell has an antenna that communicates with nearby devices and hands off connections between cells as needed.
